alert.note: Alert for Coconino; Navajo (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued August 11 at 6:50PM MST until August 11 at 10:00PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has issued a * Flash Flood Warning for... eastern Coconino County in Arizona... central Navajo County in Arizona... * Until 1000 PM MST. * At 648 PM MST, Doppler radar indicated thunderstorms producing heavy rain near Second Mesa. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional rainfall amounts up to 0.5 inches are possible. Flash flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding. SOURCE...Radar. IMPACT...Life-threatening flash flooding of low-water crossings, creeks, normally dry washes and roads. * Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Second Mesa, Hopi Reservation, Tolani Lake, Shongopovi, and portions of the Navajo Reservation. This includes the following highways... State Route 264 between mile markers 377 and 391. State Route 87 between mile markers 398 and 406. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Wepo Wash, Oraibi Wash and Polacca Wash. FLASH FLOOD...RADAR INDICATED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. There are many low water crossings which will become dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route. Remain alert for flooding even in locations not receiving rain. Normally dry washes, slot canyons and creeks can become raging killer currents in a matter of minutes, even from distant rainfall.
